name: Farfetch'd

attacks.name: Leek Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. Either way, you can't use this attack again as long as Farfetch'd stays in play (even putting Farfetch'd on the Bench won't let you use it again).

flavorText: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. This sprig is used much like a metal sword.

strengths: Leek Slap can do 30 damage for 1 energy
weaknesses: Leek Slap is coin flip AND can only be used once
Pot Smash is inefficient at 3 energy for 30
synergies: Scoop Up - Reset Leek Slap by returning to hand

competitiveHistory: Farfetch'd was rarely played competitively. Leek Slap's restriction of only being usable once per game (while in play) made it unreliable, and Pot Smash was inefficient compared to other options.

rulings.ruling: Leek Slap can only be used ONCE while Farfetch'd is in play. Even benching it doesn't reset this.
If Farfetch'd is returned to your hand (Scoop Up) and played again, it's considered a new Pokemon and can use Leek Slap again.
If Leek Slap fails (tails), you still cannot use it again while Farfetch'd remains in play.
Pot Smash has no additional effect.
